article.headline: Prairie View 78, Alcorn St. 55
article.story: LORMAN, Miss. -- Derek Johnson scored 22 points and Prairie View A&M defeated Alcorn State 78-55 in the Southwestern Athletic Conference opener for both teams on Saturday night. Prairie View (4-9) shot 49.2 percent (30 of 61) from the field, including 50 percent (11 of 22) in the second half. Dorian McDaniel scored 17 points and was 3 of 5 from 3-point range for the Panthers. Michael Griffin added five steals and Christopher Jones grabbed nine rebounds for Prairie View A&M. Alcorn State (2-11), which committed 18 turnovers, shot 33.3 perdcent from the field (19 of 57). The Braves were led by Jonathan Boyd with 14 points, Darius Hobson with 11 and Jarvis Williams with 10.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
